comments.raw_text: Wow, that's definitely odd. It probably is trying to grab the whole database somehow--this is another issue that bug 632717 will fix.
comments.creator: mkanat@bugzilla.org
comments.author: mkanat@bugzilla.org
comments.text: Wow, that's definitely odd. It probably is trying to grab the whole database somehow--this is another issue that bug 632717 will fix.
But we should also address the fact that this malformed search was allowed through.
comments.author: mkanat@bugzilla.org
comments.creator: mkanat@bugzilla.org
comments.raw_text: But we should also address the fact that this malformed search was allowed through.

I've fixed the blocker, so by default Bugzilla can now only return 10,000 results, ever, for any search.

However, if you're searching for an exact value in a select field, and that value doesn't exist, we should probably throw an error, instead of risking running a search that will essentially have no criteria.
comments.text:
I've fixed the blocker, so by default Bugzilla can now only return 10,000 results, ever, for any search.

However, if you're searching for an exact value in a select field, and that value doesn't exist, we should probably throw an error, instead of risking running a search that will essentially have no criteria.
comments.author: mkanat@bugzilla.org
comments.creator: mkanat@bugzilla.org
